While there are signs of growing opposition and potential fragmentation of the opposition vote, Fidesz-KDNP's strong organizational structure, popularity of its leader Viktor Orbán, and the current electoral system in Hungary all contribute to its likelihood of maintaining its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question is asking about the likelihood of the European Union announcing new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. To estimate this probability, we need to consider the current trade relationship between the EU and China, as well as any recent developments or trends that may indicate a shift in trade policies. Firstly, the EU has been actively promoting the development of its own electric vehicle industry, and has implemented various incentives and regulations to encourage the adoption of electric vehicles within the region. This suggests that the EU may be motivated to protect its domestic industry from external competition, potentially through the imposition of tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles. Secondly, there have been ongoing trade tensions between the EU and China in recent years, with both sides imposing tariffs on each other's goods. This history of trade tensions increases the likelihood of the EU imposing new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicles. Thirdly, the EU has been actively monitoring the Chinese electric vehicle market and has expressed concerns about the potential impact of cheap Chinese imports on the EU's domestic industry. This suggests that the EU may be considering measures to protect its industry, including the imposition of tariffs or duties. However, it's worth noting that the EU has also been trying to maintain a good trade relationship with China, and may be hesitant to impose new tariffs or duties that could escalate trade tensions. Additionally, the EU has a complex decision-making process, and any decision to impose new tariffs or duties would need to be agreed upon by all member states. Overall, considering these factors, I estimate the probability of the European Union announcing new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, to be around 60%. This reflects the potential motivations for the EU to protect its domestic industry, as well as the ongoing trade tensions between the EU and China. However, it also takes into account the complexity of the EU's decision-making process and the potential desire to maintain a good trade relationship with China.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of the domestic box office opening of 'Deadpool & Wolverine' being higher than that of 'Deadpool' and 'The Wolverine' combined, let's consider several factors: 1. Franchise Growth and Popularity: The 'Deadpool' franchise has shown significant growth in popularity since the release of the first film in 2016. The success of 'Deadpool' and its sequel 'Deadpool 2' indicates a strong fan base and increasing interest in the character. The combination of Deadpool with Wolverine, another popular character from the X-Men franchise, could potentially draw a larger audience than either character could alone. 2. Combined Appeal: The combination of Deadpool and Wolverine in a single film could attract fans of both characters, potentially leading to a larger opening weekend than the sum of their individual films. The contrast between the dark, serious tone often associated with Wolverine and the irreverent humor of Deadpool could create a unique and appealing dynamic. 3. Market Trends and Competition: The box office performance of recent superhero movies, especially those within the Marvel universe, has been strong. If 'Deadpool & Wolverine' is well-received by critics and audiences, it could capitalize on the current trend of successful superhero films. However, the competitive landscape and the timing of the release (e.g., summer blockbuster season) will also play a role in its performance. 4. Marketing and Production Quality: The success of the film will also depend on the quality of the movie itself, including factors like storytelling, action sequences, and the chemistry between the leads. Effective marketing campaigns can also significantly impact opening weekend numbers. Considering these factors, there's a reasonable basis to believe that combining two popular characters could lead to a higher box office opening than their individual films. However, predicting box office performance is inherently uncertain due to the many variables involved.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Huffman has expressed strong opposition to the plan, stating that it's a 'really bad move' and that it won't achieve unity. The fact that a letter has already been drafted and that Huffman has spoken out publicly suggests that there is significant opposition to the plan among Democrats. However, it's worth noting that the question requires at least 20 signatures, which is a relatively high threshold. Given these factors, I estimate the probability of at least 20 Democrats signing a public letter opposing the plan to be around 0.6. question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question of whether Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024 is uncertain, but we can consider some factors to make an educated estimate. A brokered convention occurs when no candidate receives a majority of delegates in the first round of voting, leading to multiple rounds of voting. In recent years, the Democratic Party has trended towards more candidates running in the primary, which increases the likelihood of a brokered convention. However, the party has also implemented rules changes aimed at reducing the likelihood of a brokered convention, such as the use of proportional allocation of delegates and the elimination of superdelegates. Additionally, the 2024 primary field is still taking shape, and it's unclear how many viable candidates will emerge. Given these factors, I estimate the probability of a brokered convention as follows.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of President Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, let's consider the following factors: 1. Political Climate: The political environment in the United States is highly polarized. The mention of a GOP lawmaker asking Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office indicates a level of opposition from the Republican party. However, the invocation of the 25th Amendment requires a significant level of consensus, especially when it involves the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet, which are currently controlled by the Democratic party. 2. Procedural Difficulty: The 25th Amendment Section 4 is a rarely used provision that requires a high threshold of agreement among the Vice President and the Cabinet. It is designed for situations where the President is clearly unable to perform their duties, such as severe illness or incapacitation. The bar for invoking this section is intentionally set high to prevent its use as a political tool. 3. Precedent and Implications: There is no recent precedent for the successful invocation of the 25th Amendment Section 4 against a President's will. Such an action would be unprecedented in U.S. history and would have significant constitutional and political implications. It would likely be challenged legally and could lead to a constitutional crisis. 4. Timing: The question specifies a resolution before August 2024. Given the current political landscape and the procedural hurdles involved, it seems unlikely that such a significant and unprecedented action could be initiated and completed within this timeframe, especially considering the potential legal challenges and political fallout. Considering these factors, the likelihood of President Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 appears to be low due to the significant political, procedural, and constitutional barriers.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

metadata.chain_of_thought: The question is asking whether Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. To answer this question, we need to consider the likelihood of such an event occurring. Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, also known as the Disqualification Clause, states that individuals who have engaged in insurrection or rebellion against the United States, or given aid or comfort to its enemies, are disqualified from holding federal office. There have been efforts to invoke this clause to disqualify Trump from running for office due to his role in the January 6, 2021, storming of the U.S. Capitol. However, the process of removing someone from the ballot under Section 3 is complex and involves various legal and political hurdles. It would require a state or federal court to rule that Trump's actions meet the criteria for disqualification, and then for the state to take action to remove him from the ballot. Given the complexity of the process and the limited time frame before the July 15, 2024, deadline, it is unlikely that Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. While there may be ongoing legal challenges and efforts to disqualify Trump, the likelihood of a successful outcome by the specified date is low.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

metadata.chain_of_thought: Both Meta and Anthropic are prominent players in the AI research and development space, and they have been actively working on improving the safety of their AI models. Red-teaming, which involves simulating adversarial attacks on a system to test its defenses, is a common practice in the industry to identify and address potential safety vulnerabilities. Given the growing importance of AI safety, it is likely that both companies will prioritize this aspect and engage external parties to conduct red-teaming exercises. Furthermore, publishing the results of such exercises can help build trust and demonstrate transparency, which is essential for companies operating in the AI space. Therefore, it is reasonable to expect that at least one of the two companies will publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models by June 30, 2024.

question.title: Will Croatia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of Croatia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, we need to consider several factors. Firstly, Croatia has participated in the Eurovision Song Contest consistently since its debut in 1993, with the exception of a few years. This suggests that they are likely to participate in the contest again in 2024. Secondly, the qualification process for the Grand Final involves a semi-final round where countries compete to secure a spot in the final. The top 10 countries from each semi-final, as determined by a combination of jury and public voting, qualify for the Grand Final. While it's difficult to predict the performance of Croatia's entry, the country has had a mixed record in the contest, with some successful years and some less successful ones. However, given the large number of participating countries and the unpredictable nature of the contest, it's challenging to make an accurate prediction. Nevertheless, assuming Croatia participates in the semi-final, their chances of qualifying for the Grand Final are likely to be around 50%, as approximately half of the participating countries in the semi-finals qualify for the final.

question.title: Will both Croatia and Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Croatia and Malta participate in their respective Semi-finals and are then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of both Croatia and Malta qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, we need to consider several factors, including their past performances, the competitiveness of their respective semi-finals, and any changes to the contest format or voting rules that may impact their chances. Historically, Croatia has had mixed results in Eurovision, with some years seeing them qualify for the Grand Final and others not. Malta, on the other hand, has generally been a consistent qualifier, often finishing in the top 10 in the Grand Final. However, it's difficult to make predictions based solely on past performance, as the contest is highly unpredictable and can be influenced by many factors, such as the quality of the songs, the performance on the night, and the voting patterns of the different countries. Given the lack of information about the specific songs and performances for Eurovision 2024, it's challenging to make an informed prediction about the likelihood of both Croatia and Malta qualifying. However, assuming that both countries will participate in their respective semi-finals and that the contest format and voting rules remain largely the same as in previous years, I would estimate that the probability of both countries qualifying is around 0.4. This estimate is based on the general trend of Malta being a consistent qualifier and Croatia having a more mixed record. However, it's essential to note that this is a rough estimate and should be taken as a rough order of magnitude rather than a precise prediction.
